org.richfaces.component

Class AbstractInputNumberSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.faces.component.UIComponent
      • javax.faces.component.UIComponentBase
        • javax.faces.component.UIOutput
          • javax.faces.component.UIInput
            • org.richfaces.component.UIInputNumber
              • org.richfaces.component.AbstractInputNumberSlider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, javax.faces.component.EditableValueHolder, javax.faces.component.PartialStateHolder, javax.faces.component.StateHolder, javax.faces.component.TransientStateHolder, javax.faces.component.ValueHolder, javax.faces.event.ComponentSystemEventListener, javax.faces.event.FacesListener, javax.faces.event.SystemEventListenerHolder, AccesskeyProps, CoreProps, DisabledProps, EventsKeyProps, EventsMouseProps, FocusProps, I18nProps, InputProps
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlInputNumberSlider

    public abstract class AbstractInputNumberSlider
extends UIInputNumber
implements AccesskeyProps, CoreProps, EventsKeyProps, EventsMouseProps, FocusProps, I18nProps, InputProps

    The &lt;r:inputNumberSlider&gt; component provides a slider for changing numerical values. Optional features include control arrows to step through the values, a tool-tip to display the value while sliding, and a text field for typing the numerical value which can then be validated against the slider's range.

      • isReadonly

        public abstract boolean isReadonly()
        Description copied from interface: InputProps
        Flag indicating that this component will prohibit changes by the user. The element may receive focus unless it has also been disabled. A value of false causes no attribute to be rendered, while a value of true causes the attribute to be rendered as readonly="readonly".
        Specified by:
        isReadonly in interface InputProps

      • getDelay

        public abstract int getDelay()
        Delay in pressed increase/decrease arrows in miliseconds. <br />Default value is "200".

      • isEnableManualInput

        public abstract boolean isEnableManualInput()
        If set to "false" this attribute makes the text field "read-only", so the value can be changed only from a handle. <br />Default value is "true".

      • getInputPosition

        public abstract InputNumberSliderInputPosition getInputPosition()
        If "right", the InputText Box would be rendered on the right side of the ruler. If "left", the InputText Box would be rendered on the left side of the ruler. If "top", the InputText Box would be rendered on the top of the ruler. If "bottom", the InputText Box would be rendered on the bottom of the ruler.

      • getInputSize

        public abstract int getInputSize()
        Similar to the "Size" attribute of h:inputText.
        Default value is "3".

      • getMaxValue

        public abstract String getMaxValue()
        Attribute to set an "end" value.
        Default value is "100"

      • getMaxlength

        public abstract Integer getMaxlength()
        Specifies the maximum number of digits that could be entered into the input field. The maximum number is unlimited by default. If entered value exceeds the value specified in "maxValue" attribute than the slider takes a maximum value position.

      • getMinValue

        public abstract String getMinValue()
        Attribute to set the "start" value.
        Default value is "0"

      • isShowArrows

        public abstract boolean isShowArrows()
        False value for this attribute makes increase/decrease arrows invisible.
        Default value is "false".

      • isShowBoundaryValues

        public abstract boolean isShowBoundaryValues()
        If the min/max values are shown on the right/left borders of a control.
        Default value is "true".

      • isShowInput

        public abstract boolean isShowInput()
        False value for this attribute makes text a field invisible.
        Default value is "true".

      • isShowTooltip

        public abstract boolean isShowTooltip()
        If "true"the current value is shown in the tooltip when a handle control is in a "dragged" state.
        Default value is "true".

      • getStep

        public abstract String getStep()
        Parameter that determines a step between the nearest values while using a handle.
        Default value is "1".

      • getTooltipClass

        public abstract String getTooltipClass()
        Assigns one or more space-separated CSS class names to the tooltip element of the handle

      • getTrackClass

        public abstract String getTrackClass()
        Assigns one or more space-separated CSS class names to the track slider element

      • getHandleType

        public abstract InputNumberSliderHandleType getHandleType()
        Tells how handle should look like. Possible values: arrow (default), bar
